moves.1. e4 e5: a usual start off, this helps me into a more comfortable, familliar game.
moves.2. Qh5: a fun move, somtimes gets me good position, or if there not paying attension the 4 move.
moves.2... d6: he wasnt fooled by this, but i have more up my sleeve, i go in for the kill.
moves.3. Bc4 g6: most obviously he has seen this before, i quickly retreat, but keep my position focused on f7.
moves.4. Qf3 Qe7: no easy win here, but the position i now have isnt so bad, lets work with it.
moves.5. d3: a move both offensive and defensive. this gives my dark squared bishop a chance to stretch his legs.
moves.5... Nf6: a good move on blacks part.
moves.6... Bg7 7. Bxf6: a quick tradeoff and we are back on track.
moves.7... Bxf6: i reinforce my using my b1 knight, also making room for a castle.
moves.8. Nc3: he takes his chance to do so
moves.8... O-O: he isnt ready for an attack on d5, i make my move.
moves.9... Qd8: i go in for the queen trade, this annoys some people but is familiar ground for me.
moves.10. Nxf6+: stubborn, some people just want to keep there queens.
moves.11. Nd5: angry, he moves in to take the knight that slaughtered his dark bishop.
moves.12. Nc3 Qg5 13. g3 Bg4 14. Qe3: i offer the queen trade again.
moves.15. h3: get your bishop out of here.
moves.16... Bxg4: a mistake, taking this bishop meant losing my rook.
moves.17. h4 Bd7: lets take this to the other side of the board.
moves.18... b5 19. axb5 cxb5: the bishop is now threatened, my knight snaps into action.
moves.20. Nxb5 Nc6: he leaves his pawn wide open, i take the chance to control the pawn causing lots of problems.
moves.21. Nxd6 Rab8: an attempt for an easy point.
moves.22. b3: since i cant castle, i make due with what i can.
moves.22... Nb4 23. Rc1 Na2 24. Rb1 Nc3: the beginning of the end, now watch.
moves.28. Rxa7: he reinforces the bishop in which i have no intention of taking.
moves.28... Rfb8: dummy, loosened up your other defences.
moves.29. Rxf7+ Kg8: and the painful choice strikes, this is where it gets interesting.
moves.30. Rf5+ Bxc4 31. Rxh5: so now he lost his queen, but does he take my rook or keep his bisop?
moves.31... gxh5: he decides that the rook is a better desicion.
moves.32. dxc4 Rd6+ 33. Kc3 Rd1: the best move of the day, time to  get my queen in action for the first time since the very beggining of the game.
moves.34. Qg3+ Kf7 35. Qxe5: if i take out his pawns, he cant hope to win.
moves.37. Qxh7 Rc1: he needs to plan out his moves better.
moves.40. Qd1 Rxe4 41. Qf3+: the pawn gets avenged, game over for this guy, he quit at this point in time.
